channel.title: Parents
channel.description:
I received an email from my dad the other day,
[i]"Do you know who these people are? I just tripped over this pic and thought I would share it."[/i]
with a picture of him and my step mum on their wedding day! I don't know what to make of it... does anyone have any advice for me?

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:17, topic:341606”][quote author=Davidude link=topic=438008.msg3219370#msg3219370 date=1275037367]
It’s strange because just today I got an email saying:

To David surname
full address

David,

Are you still at my address?
You may be eligible to receive upto 11,489 GBP in government money that you would NEVER HAVE TO REPAY.

Complete your application at ukgrants.be

Bit in stars I edited out for personal security, but it freaked me out. It’s easy to see its a spam email and I realised right away but how the fuck did they get my address, full name and also know that I’m trying to sort out university finance at the moment…

Try going to ukgrants.be and leaving, popup box comes up and asks you if you are sure. What kind of official website doesn’t let people leave before they’ve read a paragraph on why they should get a grant…
[/quote]maybe we just can’t trust student finance with our personal details. either that, or you have spyware that monitors the sites you visit and harvests personal info…[/quote]
including pics of susie…

Read full topic

Try going to ukgrants.be and leaving, popup box comes up and asks you if you are sure. What kind of official website doesn’t let people leave before they’ve read a paragraph on why they should get a grant…[/quote]maybe we just can’t trust student finance with our personal details. either that, or you have spyware that monitors the sites you visit and harvests personal info…

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Turns out its all OK, my dad sent it.

When I spoke to him he said he had only forwarded on the email which he had sent too some other relatives (kids) who have never met them! Because he thought it was a nice picture. When I asked him he laughed at me and thought it was quite funny that I got worked up about it! LOL

Read full topic

To David surname
full address

David,

Are you still at my address?
You may be eligible to receive upto 11,489 GBP in government money that you would NEVER HAVE TO REPAY.

Complete your application at ukgrants.be

Bit in stars I edited out for personal security, but it freaked me out. It’s easy to see its a spam email and I realised right away but how the fuck did they get my address, full name and also know that I’m trying to sort out university finance at the moment…[/quote]
Facebook.

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

It’s strange because just today I got an email saying:

To David *surname* *full address*

David,

Are you still at my address?
You may be eligible to receive upto 11,489 GBP in government money that you would NEVER HAVE TO REPAY.

Complete your application at ukgrants.be


Bit in stars I edited out for personal security, but it freaked me out. It’s easy to see its a spam email and I realised right away but how the fuck did they get my address, full name and also know that I’m trying to sort out university finance at the moment…

Try going to ukgrants.be and leaving, popup box comes up and asks you if you are sure. What kind of official website doesn’t let people leave before they’ve read a paragraph on why they should get a grant…

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

“I just tripped over this pic and thought I would share it.”

this is the sus bit.
I’m going with virus.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @Frostie21 Frostie21
item.description:
@Frostie21 wrote:

I thought it was a virus such as mopman said,that’d be a really weird way of wording “I want you to spend more time with us”.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

Maybe your dad was drunk? Just ask, it’s not such a big deal.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

what a weird way to say that

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

They probably just miss you and they are hinting that you should spend some time with them…

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

its a png and my dad runs w7 :s

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Just a thought, it’s how a lot of worms used to spread.

Is the attachment just a jpeg? That would make it less likely I guess There was a GDI+ exploit a few years ago that allowed you to run arbitrary code from a jpeg, but that was patched timeee ago, so unless theyre running like XP with no patches or some shit

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

oh I see, I’m going to call my dad about it tomorrow…

It does seem strange but viable that he could have sent it at the same time because since I have come to university I haven’t really kept much contact.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

… did ollie get a lobotomy

As in, your parents PC has a virus that spreads itself by mass mailing to everyone in their address book with a random pic it pulls off their PC with the intention of infecting you with it

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

What do you mean a worm?

Read full topic

item.description:

Uh, are you sure it’s not a worm?
